verses.verse: So these three <WH7969> men <WH582> ceased <WH7673> to answer <WH6030> Job <WH347>, because he was righteous <WH6662> in his own eyes <WH5869>.

Then was kindled <WH2734> the wrath <WH639> of Elihu <WH453> the son <WH1121> of Barachel <WH1292> the Buzite <WH940>, of the relatives <WH4940> of Ram <WH7410>: against Job <WH347> was his wrath <WH639> kindled <WH2734>, because he justified <WH6663> himself <WH5315> rather than God <WH430>.
Also against his three <WH7969> friends <WH7453> was his wrath <WH639> kindled <WH2734>, because they had found <WH4672> no answer <WH4617>, and yet had condemned <WH7561> Job <WH347>.
Now Elihu <WH453> had waited <WH2442> until Job <WH347> had spoken <WH1697>, because they were elder than he <WH2205>.
When Elihu <WH453> saw <WH7200> that there was no answer <WH4617> in the mouth <WH6310> of these three <WH7969> men <WH582>, then his wrath <WH639> was kindled <WH2734>.

And Elihu <WH453> the son <WH1121> of Barachel <WH1292> the Buzite <WH940> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>, I am young <WH6810>, and you are very old <WH3453>; therefore I was afraid <WH2119>, and dared <WH3372> not show <WH2331> you my opinion <WH1843>.
I said <WH559>, Days <WH3117> should speak <WH1696>, and multitude <WH7230> of years <WH8141> should teach <WH3045> wisdom <WH2451>.
But <WH403> there is a spirit <WH7307> in man <WH582>: and the inspiration <WH5397> of the Almighty <WH7706> gives them understanding <WH995>.
Great men <WH7227> are not always wise <WH2449>: neither do the aged <WH2205> understand <WH995> judgment <WH4941>.
Therefore I said <WH559>, Listen <WH8085> to me <WH2331>; I also will show my opinion <WH1843>.
Behold <WH3176>, I waited for your words <WH1697>; I gave ear <WH238> to your reasons <WH8394>, while you searched out <WH2713> what to say <WH4405>.
Yes <WH995>, I attended unto you <WH3198>, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job <WH347>, or that answered <WH6030> his words <WH561>:
Lest you should say <WH559>, We have found out <WH4672> wisdom <WH2451>: God <WH410> thrusts him down <WH5086>, not man <WH376>.
Now he has not directed <WH6186> his words <WH4405> against me <WH7725>: neither will I answer him with your speeches <WH561>.
They were amazed <WH2865>, they answered <WH6030> no more <WH6275>: they left off speaking <WH4405>.
When I had waited <WH3176>, (for they spoke <WH1696> not <WH5975>, but stood still, and answered no more <WH6030>;)
I said <WH6030>, I will answer also my part <WH2506>, I also will show <WH2331> my opinion <WH1843>.
For I am full <WH4390> of words <WH4405>, the spirit <WH7307> inside <WH990> me constrains me <WH6693>.
Behold <WH990>, my belly is as wine <WH3196> which has no vent <WH6605>; it is ready to burst <WH1234> like new <WH2319> bottles <WH178>.
I will speak <WH1696>, that I may be refreshed <WH7304>: I will open <WH6605> my lips <WH8193> and answer <WH6030>.
Let me not <WH5375>, I pray you, accept any man <WH376>'s person <WH6440>, neither let me give flattering titles <WH3655> unto man <WH120>.
For I know <WH3045> not to give flattering titles <WH3655>; in so doing my maker <WH6213> would soon <WH4592> take me away <WH5375>.
